column106: The system sometimes doesn't simplify the expression enough (like double negation or repeated clauses), which makes it difficult to read in natural language. Also, it is often the case that the "or" operator is translated as "a or b" while the natural language "or" often implies the "exlusive or", making it ambiguous. It sometimes handily describes it in terms of "at least one of the following hold", which is definitely better in my opinion. The system deals well with implications and more simple expressions.
column107: The discrepancy between the logical "or" and the natural language "or" might be really hard - if not impossible - to overcome in written language, since the difference is mostly accentuated by intonation (so only in spoken language). In Dutch and English, the logical "or" can sometimes be made clear by discarding the article of the second element of the clause (e.g. "Zullen we een biertje of wijntje doen?", "Shall I take a book or magazine with me?"), but this is still situational. However, the "exclusive or" can be written as "óf ... óf ..." and "either ... or ..."
